thread.title: San Marcos Tornado: Videos Show Damage And Hail, New Braunfels Affected | Times Now
thread.title_full: San Marcos Tornado: Videos Show Damage And Hail, New Braunfels Affected | Times Now

author: TN World Desk
title: San Marcos Tornado: Videos Show Damage And Hail, New Braunfels Affected | Times Now
text: San Marcos Tornado: Videos Show Damage And Hail, New Braunfels Affected Videos coming from San Marcos show severe damage due to a violent thunderstorm as a tornado warning in the Texas city expired. A severe thunderstorm warning still persists. Meanwhile, nearby areas - New Braunfels and Austin - are also on alert. Thunderstorm in San Marcos on Thursday Photo : Twitter Videos coming from San Marcos show severe damage due to a violent thunderstorm as a tornado warning in the Texas city expired. A severe thunderstorm warning still persists. Meanwhile, nearby areas - New Braunfels and Austin - are also on alert. The National Weather Service (NWS) asked residents in the affected areas to take shelter as soon as possible. Several social media users posted videos and pictures of baseball-size hail raining down from the sky. "STRONG ROTATION ON RADAR HEADING DIRECTLY INTO SAN MARCOS. Get into an interior room of your home immediately. This tornado will be followed by destructive baseball size hail," a weather forecaster warning ahead of the storm. Locals said multiple trees were uprooted and homes were damaged in San Marcos. The tornado is moving southeast of the city, towards Georgetown. "Praying for my parents, family and friends. Major storm with a history of producing a tornado, very large hail and strong winds just hit them. They are hunkered down but just lost electricity. üôèüèΩ," one person said on X, platform formerly known as Twitter. The National Weather Service issued tornado watches in multiple North and West Texas counties. The following were affected (as of the 9 PM update): Bosque, Coleman, Coryell, Ellis, Hill, Kimble, Mcculloch, Mills, Runnels, Taylor, Brown, Comanche, Dallas, Erath, Hood, Lampasas, McLennan, Palo Pinto, San Saba, Stephens, Callahan, Concho, Eastland, Hamilton, Johnson, Mason, Menard, Parker, Shackelford and Tarrant. The NWS had earlier said that the severe weather in Texas will impact regions from the Hill Country into the Interstate 35 corridor and coastal plains.
